name: Overview
data:
[{"id":"ea04d06d-1049-49d9-92fa-63625010cd26","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Class Documentation: ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"CallGraph","styles":{"code":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"04fd2889-1e7b-4729-af56-032d2cb26386","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"CallGraph","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" class represents a directed graph of function and method calls discovered during analysis. In this graph, ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"nodes","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are unique namespaces (callable entities like functions or classes), and ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"edges","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" represent the "calls" relationship (e.g., Function A calls Function B).","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"858789d3-9c43-4f5c-8812-77ee19a431f7","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"This class is the primary data structure used by Jarvis to visualize and analyze the high-level architecture and dependency flow of a software project.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"7ae667bf-645b-4e40-9bc3-59e8c4758e60","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"a85427f5-22cc-4661-bf45-aa6a392785d4","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Attributes","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"d11f79b3-27a6-4fbc-9d5b-eb179349f27b","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"cg","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"dict","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"): The adjacency list of the graph. Keys are source namespaces, and values are ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"set","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" objects containing all destination namespaces called by that source.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"6c560bb4-bc60-4f62-9306-6af40033dca5","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"modules","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"dict","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"): A mapping that links each node (namespace) in the graph back to its owning module, providing architectural context.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"cab8bba9-7a04-4c83-bd9b-b94af19cf29f","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"6bf76943-0b86-4574-8492-502c2463b043","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Methods","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"371937a9-47e3-4003-aa6a-312b49956d9a","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"__init__()

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Initializes an empty call graph and a fresh module mapping registry.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"c2987cc6-6291-484f-a4da-2ca42732ba83","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"add_node(name, module=None)

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Registers a namespace as a node in the graph. It ensures that the node exists in the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"cg","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" dictionary and associates it with a ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"module","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" name if provided.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"b7c118a0-3dc8-407a-9110-1000d3f0c884","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"add_edge(src, dest)

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Creates a link between two nodes. It includes internal filtering logic to ignore "noise" nodes such as control-flow artifacts (e.g., ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"IF_DEF","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"), return placeholders, or basic primitive types, ensuring the graph remains focused on functional logic.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"6de1c706-aeb9-411b-b6b7-793c173f145d","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"add_edges(src, destList)

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"A bulk insertion utility. It registers the source node and iterates through a list of destinations, adding each one as a node and establishing the directed edge from the source.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"653a9aa4-0892-442b-8d13-2ecc30c737ac","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"is_exist_edge(src, dest)","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" / ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"existEdge(src)

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Boolean helpers to check for the presence of specific relationships or to determine if a node has any outgoing calls.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"6af775db-4c99-423c-b460-4fb8fb0f4b96","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"get_edges()

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Flattens the graph into a list of tuples ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"(source, destination)","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":". This is the standard format used for exporting data to visualization tools or generating reports.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"3ead76a1-f701-42cb-8452-0c4282583168","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"get_modules()

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Retrieves the metadata mapping that shows which code file (module) contains which function node.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"8658a470-5a10-48d1-bda3-f0eb7ac44b5c","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"c057218a-ea73-46e9-9ba4-aae4e60010c2","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Usage Example","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"f60232dc-31b7-4d2b-92e2-ebfe1719073e","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"CallGraph","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is populated as the analyzer resolves function calls recorded by the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"CallManager","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"dcb93148-fc27-46e6-bdba-beacb9356e45","type":"codeBlock","props":{"language":"python"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"from call_graph import CallGraph

# 1. Initialize the graph
graph = CallGraph()

# 2. Add relationships
# Context: 'app.main.run' calls both 'app.auth.login' and 'app.db.connect'
graph.add_edges("app.main.run", ["app.auth.login", "app.db.connect"])

# 3. Check for specific dependencies
if graph.is_exist_edge("app.main.run", "app.auth.login"):
    print("Security dependency detected: 'run' triggers 'login'.")

# 4. Export the graph for a report
all_links = graph.get_edges()
for src, dest in all_links:
    print(f"{src} -> {dest}")

# Output:
# app.main.run -> app.auth.login
# app.main.run -> app.db.connect","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"e3ec9c02-acf7-4918-93dd-d805b95260b1","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Insights","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"ec9d279b-3b19-473e-b016-ece5c4e3d5d3","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Artifact Filtering","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": By filtering out internal constructs like ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"RETURN_DEF","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"CallGraph","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" provides a clean, human-readable view of the software's logic rather than a cluttered map of every internal engine state.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"6b47953e-c6d5-4e1b-9ef9-340bcb22ca0c","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Architectural Context","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": The inclusion of module mapping allows Jarvis to group function calls by file, making it possible to visualize not just function-to-function calls, but module-to-module dependencies.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"02a05381-7182-44b4-b86c-6f37473e9bb0","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Adjacency List Design","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": Using a dictionary of sets (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"cg","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":") ensures that redundant calls (calling the same function twice in one block) do not result in duplicate edges, keeping the graph mathematically sound.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"592effe8-68a5-40af-8c11-2aac2709484f","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[],"children":[]}]
